p: Humans are currently an interesting potential viral reservoir. We are expanding rapidly in population size â€“ from about a billion-and-a-half individuals, we have grown to about seven-and-a-half-billion in the last 130 years alone [ 1]. In doing so, we are conquering new territories, clearing forests, draining wetlands, hunting for pleasure and reducing overall biodiversity [ 1]. This is making it increasingly difficult for others to survive, while there are more and more of us. Fortunately for us all, the first four human-adapted coronaviruses were merely the cause of common colds [ 2]. No-one considered the four of them a serious threat to public health.
